text: Stranded on a dangerous and primitive planet with only a sword, our Hero begins his adventure.
author: Warfare Octopus

text: This game was so much better than the fourth one, who is just a bad joke.
author: Siquall77

text: Maria and Peppita were my favorite. I think I beat the game by spamming Icicle Spears or whatever it was.
author: Sayeth Di Puppeth

text: This game broke my heart. It started off promising but it fell apart in nearly every area as it went along. The plot twist just further added insult to injury. This series and me in general don't seem to click as even the remake of the original bored me and SO4 was terrible. SO2 is considered the holy grail in the franchise but seeing as I have disliked every other SO game and their design is the same at the core and didn't do anything for me, may be the series for me in general that I can't enjoy.
author: xOmniCloudx

text: Sorry you didn't approve of it, I found it to be the most enjoyable of the series.
author: Velacroix

text: One of the best RPGs on the PS2, so many hours I put into this game. So worth it.
author: Drilbit

text: I got stuck in the hotel for about 2 months, then finally turned it back on and loved every minute after!
author: Worst88

text: Upload some Star Ocean First Departure soundtracks! The remake one on the PSP has some really nice OSTs
author: ThePhatWabbit

text: Sounds so good. Good ole Cliff solo through the whole game.
author: TrueHolyRune

text: I need to get this game an replay it again, been almost 8 years since i last played it
author: Mohammedius

text:
Most fun charater to me is still Cliff on FAM (best feature of the entire game) with Hammer of Might on both X-Long and O-Long. ;-) But of course nothing can stand up to Mario especially in post game dungeons. I managed to get all three "Freya on 4D" Battle Trophies at the same time with only Maria even though I ran out of Stun Bombs halfway through the fight. That's how overpowered she is.
Never used Albel though aside from my very first playthrough.
author: Desty Nova

text: Blade.......OF FURY
author: Satanic Chocobo

text:
I really love the soundtrack to this game.
Also nice to see you pick another theme after exactly 1000.
author: Azure Alufei

text: I hated this game so much growing up.  I did think the soundtrack was alright though.  This was one of my favorite songs.
author: ParrotMan01

text: this game was hard as hell , but awesome :P
author: Franco Gutierrez

text: I didn't really like this game all that much, but my god this track is so nostalgic. This, Rust Color, and The Desolate Smell of Earth are my favorites from this game. You know, I just might give this game another chance... in 10 or so years when I get through my backlog. :P
author: MastaDamascus

text: Motoi Sakuraba's best soundtrack in my opinion. I find his music, especially in SO3 invoke a sort of nostalgia with the towns and fields, they definitely make them feel unique. Also the battles themes are simply phenomenal and there was so much variety.
author: Guitarwolf

text:
Star Ocean: The Second Story is truly one of my favorite games of all time. This one wasn't quite as good, but still a solid game, and the "twist" for me, at least, was creative. Not necessarily great, but interesting enough. Nothing touches SO2, however, and I know the series has only gotten worse throughout its sequels, unfortunately.

Thanks!
author: HeroicPunk

text: Honestly I did rly enjoy this game, right up until the near end of the game, where the big 'Twist' happens, or rather moment of ruin as I like to call it. I think it was a huge cop out of a good story. All this build up and fear of this unknown force only to find out it was all nothing. I much prefer any of the other Star Ocean Games, specifically The Second Story, and The Last Hope, but hey that's just me :)
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: There are so many little known RPGs that I need to play, but I might not have the time to play them.  This series is one of them.  By the way, are the games in this series traditional RPGs?
author: Eric C.

text: Action RPGs (the Tales games are probably the closest comparison in terms of gameplay).
author: tallwhiteninja

text: This series isn't quite "little known".  This game in particular was advertised very heavily on television in the U.S. if nothing else.
author: totlyepic

text: @twilightiger Uh... the second game was released in America on PS1. It's not that hard to find either.
author: Aifread

text: @twilightiger Wait....what.....Xenosaga 1 & 2 came out in NA on the PS2?!?! #1: February 25, 2003, #2: February 15, 2005.
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: @ragnarokangaroo Xenogears was on PS1  bud
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: @Bigrog1988 Who mentioned Xenogears?
author: Aifread

text: @ragnarokangaroo Ohhh you were discussion star ocean 2...my bad...I was reading supraduckys Xenogears upload and thought this thread was about that lol
author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: Fantastic game and an incredible soundtrack. Cutting Edge of Notion and The Divine Spirit of Language still get regular play on my stereo,
author: CerberusLives

text: yeeeees Cutting Edge of Notion is super awesome.
author: LordRoto

text: I really liked this game. I know a lot of people hated the story's big twist, but it personally didn't bother me at all. I loved the gameplay and the soundtrack by Sakuraba had some very solid tracks (Rust Color being a favorite of mine). I usually always choose to control the main character in an RPG (for example, the Tales games), but this is one of the very few where I didn't; I controlled Albel instead, he was pretty overpowered.
author: SupraDarky

text: I loved this game, a lot of the dungeon themes and battle themes are some of Sakuraba's best
author: LordRoto

text: @Amsun Thales Played as Albel too. Not only because he was overpowered, but he is a cool looking badass.
author: Freyja Njordsdottir

text: Oh god yes. I controlled Albel too. He was stupidly strong and made Fayt look like a baby in comparison. Air Slash of Fury, Double Slash of Fury and his weak normal attack could be used indefinitely with the right setup. Add a bunch of those elemental balls and multi hit mods to his weapon? Everything's getting wrecked.
author: virgil9940

text: Hey, SupraDarky. Ever considered listened to the Adventure Time game soundtracks?
author: yuWIN

text: Agree 100% with your first three sentences. Always loved this game, the story, and the music, nothing bothered me at all, this game is amazing.
author: Matt Ferko
